title.bibl: Sichovi Visty (Siege News), Mar. 15, 1922. Chicago Siege Branch No. 15 Helps Ukrainian Ex-Soldiers

div.bibl: Sichovi Visty (Siege News), Mar. 15, 1922. CHICAGO SIEGE BRANCH NO. 15 HELPS UKRAINIAN EX-SOLDIERS

body.p: For singing Christmas carols, Bohdan Chmelnitsky Siege Branch No. 15, Chicago, Illinois collected $387.11, the Children's branch organized by and collateral with Branch No. 15 collected $100 and the boy's branch also gathered $100. This made a total of $587.11. To this, Mr. N. Navrotsky, financial secretary, added from the general Siege account $7.89 which made a grand total of $600. This sum, Dr. S.K. Hrynevetsky, chief executive of the Siege organization, sent to Dr. Smallstotsky for the Ukrainian ex-soldiers, definitely stating that the sum came exclusively from Bohdan Chmelnitsky Siege Branch No. 15, Chicago, Ill.
